page.title: 15BUNNY PARK HALL
page.content: Bunny Park Hall was built by Sir Thomas Parkyns in the 18th century. He enlarged the hall and built a tower in 1723. The tower has 5 storeys and joins on to the end of the house. In the tower there is a crude staircase leading to the roof. On the side of the tower there is the coat of arms of Sir Thomas Parkyns. Above the stone shield is the Parkyns crest, a large pineapple. The house is built of brick and stone. The bricks were made in the local brickyard. There are 8 bedrooms and many more other rooms. Mr. John Edwards lives there now in part of the hall which is a flat. He let children from the school go round the hall because we were doing a project about the village for the Southwell 100 exhibition. Bunny Hall is an unusual building and is being used by Central Television as the setting for a film.
